Class Checker

  • java.lang.Object
    • services.gui.Checker

  • @Singleton
public class Checker
extends java.lang.Object
    Service class that provides checks for different entities

      • checkComponentResults

        public void checkComponentResults(java.util.List<ComponentResult> componentResultList,
                                  User user,
                                  boolean studyMustNotBeLocked)
                           throws ForbiddenException,
                                  NotFoundException
        Checks a list of ComponentResult. Checks each ComponentResult whether the belonging Study and Component are fine (checkStandard). It also checks whether the study is locked.
        Parameters:
        componentResultList - A list of ComponentResults
        user - The study that corresponds to the results must have this user otherwise ForbiddenException will be thrown.
        studyMustNotBeLocked - If true the study that corresponds to the results must not be locked and it will throw an ForbiddenException.
        Throws:
        ForbiddenException
        NotFoundException

      • checkComponentResult

        public <T extends ComponentResult> void checkComponentResult(T componentResult,
                                                             User user,
                                                             boolean studyMustNotBeLocked)
                                                      throws ForbiddenException,
                                                             NotFoundException
        Checks a ComponentResult whether the belonging Study and Component are fine (checkStandard). It also checks whether the study is locked.
        Parameters:
        componentResult - A ComponentResults
        user - The study that corresponds to the results must have this user otherwise ForbiddenException will be thrown.
        studyMustNotBeLocked - If true the study that corresponds to the results must not be locked and it will throw an ForbiddenException.
        Throws:
        ForbiddenException
        NotFoundException

      • checkStudyResult

        public void checkStudyResult(StudyResult studyResult,
                             User user,
                             boolean studyMustNotBeLocked)
                      throws ForbiddenException,
                             NotFoundException
        Checks a StudyResult whether the belonging Study is fine, especially that the StudyResult belongs to this user. It also checks whether the study is locked.
        Parameters:
        studyResult - A StudyResults
        user - The study that corresponds to the results must have this user otherwise ForbiddenException will be thrown.
        studyMustNotBeLocked - If true the study that corresponds to the results must not be locked and it will throw an ForbiddenException.
        Throws:
        ForbiddenException
        NotFoundException

      • checkStudyResults

        public void checkStudyResults(java.util.List<StudyResult> studyResultList,
                              User user,
                              boolean studyMustNotBeLocked)
                       throws ForbiddenException,
                              NotFoundException
        Checks a list of StudyResult. Checks each StudyResult whether the belonging Study is fine, especially that the StudyResult belongs to this user. It also checks whether the study is locked.
        Parameters:
        studyResultList - A list of StudyResults
        user - The study that corresponds to the results must have this user otherwise ForbiddenException will be thrown.
        studyMustNotBeLocked - If true the study that corresponds to the results must not be locked and it will throw an ForbiddenException.
        Throws:
        ForbiddenException
        NotFoundException

      • checkWorker

        public void checkWorker(Worker worker,
                        java.lang.Long workerId)
                 throws BadRequestException
        Throws a Exception in case the worker doesn't exist. Distinguishes between normal and Ajax request.
        Throws:
        BadRequestException
